channel.title: MIROZA
channel.description: Modern news and articles hub. Technology, Science, and Global Trends.

item.title: AI Assistant Wars 2025: How Agentic AI Is Changing Work Forever
item.description: Agentic AI in 2025 is reshaping work: autonomous agents, new productivity models, risks and policy questions. Read a deep analysis.

item.title: The Electric Scooter Boom in India: A Silent Urban Revolution
item.description: How electric scooters transformed urban mobility across India: technology, policy, and social impacts of the EV two-wheeler boom in 2025.

item.title: Fitness 3.0: How Technology is Transforming the Indian Fitness Culture
item.description: Fitness 3.0 explores the intersection of wearable tech, AI coaches and community fitness in India, and how technology is reshaping health routines.

item.title: The Rise of Hyper-Local Content Platforms in 2025
item.description: Why hyper-local content platforms are rising in 2025: trust, community engagement, AI tools and business models shaping neighborhood journalism.

item.title: How Sleep Quality Shapes Mental Performance: The Science of the 2025 Lifestyle
item.description: Research-backed exploration of how sleep quality affects cognition, mood and productivity and practical strategies to improve rest in the digital age.

item.title: India’s Economy Grows 8.2% in Q2, Beats Forecasts
item.description: India’s economy posted a strong 8.2% year-on-year growth in Q2 2025, surpassing forecasts and boosting investor confidence.

item.title: India’s Stock Markets Hit Record High After 14-Month Rally
item.description: Indian equity indices surged to record highs, driven by easing valuations and upbeat corporate earnings outlook.

item.title: Gold Prices Climb as Investors Bet on US Rate Cut
item.description: Gold prices surged in India today, as global investors bet on a possible US interest-rate cut, prompting a rush to safe-haven assets.

item.title: IMF Reclassifies India’s Exchange Rate Regime, Markets Watch Closely
item.description: The IMF reclassified India’s exchange-rate policy regime — a move that could impact forex outlook and investor sentiment.

item.title: India’s GDP Expected to Grow 7.3% in Q2
item.description: Government sources signal that India’s quarterly GDP may expand by 7.3% in Q2, driven by manufacturing output and steady services demand.

item.title: Sensex and Nifty Open Flat Amid Global Cues
item.description: Indian benchmark indices started Tuesday’s session little changed as traders tracked mixed signals from Asian and US markets.

item.title: RBI Report Highlights Strong Investment Climate
item.description: The Reserve Bank of India’s latest bulletin notes that private capital expenditure pipelines remain robust despite global uncertainty.

item.title: India’s Manufacturing Growth Slows in November
item.description: Industry trackers say factory output moderated in November as export orders softened and firms worked through inventories.

item.title: India–Canada Trade Discussions Resume
item.description: Negotiators from India and Canada met in New Delhi to restart talks on a trade agreement after a months-long pause.

item.title: Ayodhya Ram Mandir Inauguration Preparations Intensify
item.description: Authorities in Ayodhya accelerated security, transport, and hospitality plans ahead of the Ram Mandir inauguration ceremony.

item.title: Tripura Marks 150 Years of ‘Vande Mataram’
item.description: Tripura hosted cultural programs and youth parades to celebrate 150 years since ‘Vande Mataram’ was composed.

item.title: OnePlus 15 India Launch Expectations Grow
item.description: Tech enthusiasts anticipate camera and battery upgrades as OnePlus readies its flagship 15 series for the Indian market.

item.title: Tulsi Vivah Celebrations Across India
item.description: Devotees performed traditional rituals and community feasts to mark Tulsi Vivah, ushering in the winter wedding season.

item.title: India’s Digital Payments Hit Fresh Monthly Record
item.description: UPI transactions crossed a new high in October as merchants in smaller towns embraced QR-based payments.

item.title: Western Ghats Wildlife Corridor Declared to Protect Elephants and Biodiversity
item.description: Indian Government designates 1,200 sq km area in Western Ghats as protected wildlife corridor to safeguard migrating elephants and rich biodiversity.

item.title: Global Climate Coalition Reaches Emissions Pact
item.description: Leaders from 70 nations agreed on binding methane cuts and fresh climate finance benchmarks after marathon talks in Nairobi. Observers say the pact revives trust ahead of next year’s compliance window.

item.title: Digital ID Fast-Track Links Emerging Markets
item.description: Finance ministers endorsed an interoperable ID rail to unlock cheaper remittances and portable health records. Pilot corridors covering 1.2 billion people will go live within six months.

item.title: Northern Corridor Summit Unlocks Infrastructure Funds
item.description: East African states secured $18B for rail modernization and hybrid ports to ease commodity bottlenecks. The package ties disbursements to transparent procurement dashboards overseen by regional auditors.

item.title: Asia-Pacific Ports Resume Ops After Typhoon Repairs
item.description: Logistics groups restored 80% capacity by deploying modular power barges and flexible berths across Manila, Kaohsiung, and Osaka. Relief lanes now prioritize medical cargo and cold-chain food staples.

item.title: Global Food Security Fund Expands Emergency Stockpiles
item.description: Donor blocs doubled rapid-response grain reserves and linked payouts to satellite drought triggers. Agencies expect the move to cut delivery times to high-risk regions by half.

item.title: Delhi Airport Incident: Afghan Plane Lands on Wrong Runway, Probe Launched
item.description: A flight from Kabul mistakenly landed on the wrong runway at Delhi’s IGI Airport — no casualties reported, but an official investigation has been ordered.

item.title: Eastern Coast Braces as Severe Cyclone Warning Issued
item.description: A red alert has been issued along India’s eastern coastline as a severe cyclone approaches — coastal districts begin evacuation procedures.

item.title: India Launches Massive Solar Farm Project; Rural Electrification Boost Expected
item.description: Government greenlights a new mega-solar farm project aimed at electrifying rural India and meeting renewable energy targets.

item.title: Trade Unions Stage Nationwide Protests Against New Labour Codes
item.description: Major trade unions across India have begun large-scale protests against newly implemented labour laws, demanding rollback of key provisions.

item.title: Major Trade Deal On Table: India-US Negotiations Enter Final Stage
item.description: India and the United States have reportedly moved to final-stage talks over a major trade agreement — a deal that could reshape exports and bilateral trade relations.
